motivational.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
motivational.author: Steve Jobs

motivational.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
motivational.author: Albert Schweitzer

motivational.quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
motivational.author: Albert Einstein

motivational.quote: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
motivational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

motivational.quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
motivational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

motivational.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
motivational.author: William James

motivational.quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
motivational.author: George Eliot

motivational.quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
motivational.author: Sam Levenson

motivational.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
motivational.author: Walt Whitman

motivational.quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
motivational.author: Aristotle

motivational.quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
motivational.author: Arthur Ashe

motivational.quote: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
motivational.author: Nelson Mandela

motivational.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
motivational.author: Mahatma Gandhi

motivational.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
motivational.author: Peter Drucker

motivational.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
motivational.author: Aristotle

motivational.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
motivational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

motivational.quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
motivational.author: Milton Berle

motivational.quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
motivational.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

motivational.quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
motivational.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

motivational.quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right—for you’ll be criticized anyway.
motivational.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

motivational.quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
motivational.author: Oprah Winfrey

motivational.quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
motivational.author: Oscar Wilde

motivational.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
motivational.author: Thomas Edison

motivational.quote: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
motivational.author: Charles R. Swindoll

motivational.quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
motivational.author: Albert Einstein

motivational.quote: Dream big and dare to fail.
motivational.author: Norman Vaughan

motivational.quote: Do what you love and you’ll never work a day in your life.
motivational.author: Confucius

motivational.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
motivational.author: Confucius

motivational.quote: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
motivational.author: Booker T. Washington

motivational.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
motivational.author: Mark Twain

motivational.quote: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
motivational.author: C.S. Lewis

motivational.quote: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
motivational.author: George Addair

motivational.quote: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
motivational.author: Suzy Kassem

motivational.quote: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
motivational.author: Will Rogers

motivational.quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
motivational.author: Dalai Lama
